intro: Pelea waialealae, commonly known as the Haleakalā pelea, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the Hawaiian island of Maui. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant grows in rocky, coastal areas and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and threats from habitat loss, it is classified as endangered. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect and preserve this unique species.
